result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony T Hopson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.
No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause;

Defendant Tony T Hopson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction with Huber privileges.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.
Justice Point report dated 2-15-16 received and filed./ds
Court orders continued monitoring./ds
Violation report received and filed - 1-8-16 - missed office contact./ds

Defendant Tony T Hopson in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant released to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. Defendant to notify Justice Point agent of all prescriptions including current prescriptions within 3 days of receiving prescription from any Doctor. Defendant to notify Justice Point agent  of the pharmacy used. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
